frontmatter.title: Stone Spaces

mainmatter.p:
Let L be a frame. A nucleus on L is an endofunction j : L \to L satisfying the following three conditions.
Meet preservation: \forall x, y \in L. \ j(x \wedge y) = j(x) \wedge j(y).
Inflationarity: \forall x \in L. \ x \le j(x).
Idempotence: \forall x \in L. j(j(x)) \le j(x).

A locale X is called spectral if it satisfies the following two conditions.
Every open of X is expressible as a join of compact opens of X.
The set of compact elements of X forms a sub-meet-semilattice of the frame \mathcal{O} ( X ).
A locale X is called spatial, or said to have enough points if it satisfies the condition \forall U, V \in \mathcal{O} ( X ) . \ \exists p \in \mathsf{pt} ( X ) . \ p(U) = 1 \wedge p(V) = 0.
Defined in paragraph II.1.5 (p. 42) of Stone Spaces.
